name: Vernunftkraft Odenwald e.V.
legal: registered association, VR 83873 at district court of Darmstadt, Germany
membership:
Information:
Some of the above mentioned Initiatives are organized in the form of "e.V." (registered association) according to german law.
goal: Preserve countryside local landscape with emphasis on preserving woods, natural habitats and animal life for the benefit of people living in the region and visitors seeking relaxation and health. Stop the uncoordinated and overwhelming increase in Wind Turbines; 2014:   25.000 in germany, that was 1 WT per 14,9 square km. Plans are to increase this number by the factor 3 which means there hardly remain livable areas for people and wildlife with 1 WT per 4,8 square km. The reality is much worse, as the windparks are concentrated preferably in the countryside, very often on wood covered hills, thus reducing the area for recreation and health and also the habitats of protected species like Birds (e.g. Red Milan) and Bats substantially.This development has to be stopped. Prices for Electricity go up constantly in Germany (presently 29 Ct./kWh compared to 18 Ct./kWh in 2004). Electricity Prices are second highest in Europe after Denmark. An effect on CO2 Emissions (see relevant statistics) is not measurable even if only Emissions from Electricity production are taken into account.
interests: Consumer Affairs, Energy, Environment, Justice and Fundamental Rights
euInitiatives:
1. Possibility for private persons to file law suits in case of violation of german NatSchG (Nature Protection Law) in the field of habitats (FFH, Natura 2000) and species protection (Birds, bats, Insects etc.) Appeal against such violations at the EU Commission.
2. Forbid that Windpark project planners use their own avifaunistic experts in the Nature compatibility verification process according to legalization by BimSchG §4 (Federal Immission Control Law)
3. Establish EU-wide standards for the protection of natural water resource areas against severe threatening by the 3.500 ton basements of Wind Turbines.
4.Information of local population about necessity, effectivity and CO2-relevance of Windparks, influence of above on overall employment in the energy sector, effect on electricity price development.
5. Information of local population on negative health effects of Windparks through noise, shadow effects and flashing lights at night.
6. Information of local population about negative effects upon the value of their homes by nearby windparks.
